1996.Description: Despite high immunization rates, Australia experienced multiple outbreaks of measles, primarily due to pockets of unvaccinated children.

1999.Description: South Australia reported a significant measles outbreak, leading to a re-evaluation of immunization strategies.

2005.Description: An outbreak occurred in Victoria, indicating gaps in herd immunity among young adults and adolescents.

2011.Event: Outbreak Linked to the 2011 Rugby World Cup
2011.Description: The influx of international visitors for the Rugby World Cup led to a small outbreak, reflecting the global nature of measles transmission.

2014.Description: A significant outbreak in Western Australia was traced back to a returned traveler from Southeast Asia, stressing the importance of vaccination for travelers.

2017.Description: New South Wales saw an outbreak primarily in unvaccinated individuals, leading to renewed calls for complete vaccination.

2019.Description: Alongside a global increase in measles cases, Australia reported multiple outbreaks, underscoring the ongoing risk from international movements.
